Package edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.matter

Class Actor<T extends ActionInterface>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.matter.Entity

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EntityInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HPActor
    public abstract class Actor<T extends ActionInterface>
extends Entity
    Base class for Actors, i.e. entities that can perform Actions.

    Author:
    ram

    • Constructor Detail

      • Actor

        public Actor​(MessageRenderer m)
        The constructor for the Actor

        The default constructor in the parent class (Entity) is private, so we have to pass the super constructor a parameter.

        waitime of this Actor is set to zero (0) by default.

        Parameters:
        m - a MessageRenderer that will allow the Actor to display messages

    • Method Detail

      • addAction

        public void addAction​(T a)
        Register a new Action as part of this Actor's command set.

        This does nothing if the Action is already registered, although note that it is possible to add two identically-constructed Actions to the command set if they are not the same object, i.e. the comparison is done with == rather than isEqual.

        Parameters:
        a - the Action to add

      • removeAction

        public void removeAction​(T a)
        Remove an Action from this Actors's set of potential commands. This does nothing if the Action a was not in that set.
        Parameters:
        a - the Action to remove

      • getActions

        public java.util.ArrayList<T> getActions()
        Returns an ArrayList containing references to all the Actions this Actor can currently perform.

        Does not include Affordances in objects in the same Location. Such information must be queried from the EntityManager.

        Returns:
        an ArrayList containing this Actor's Actions

      • act

        public abstract void act()
        Allows this Actor to act. This method will only be called if this Actor is not waiting.

      • tick

        public void tick​(Location l)
        Tick method for this Actor.

        This method will call the act method if this Actor is not waiting, else it will decrement the waitime of this Actor by 1 and do nothing else. TODO: Should we decrement the waittime by the tick size of the scheduler?- Asel

        Specified by:
        tick in interface EntityInterface
        Overrides:
        tick in class Entity
        Parameters:
        l - is the current Location of this Actor.
        See Also:
        waittime, act()

      • setWaittime

        public void setWaittime​(int waittime)
        Sets the waittime of this Actor to the new wait time
        Parameters:
        waittime - the new wait time of this Actor
        See Also:
        waittime

      • getWaittime

        public int getWaittime()
        Returns the waittime of this Actor.

        The tick(Location) method uses this method to determine if this Actor can act within the tick

        Returns:
        the wait time of this Actor
        See Also:
        tick(Location), waittime
